intro: Mallotus ponapensis, commonly known as the Caroline Island hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical Pacific islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a rough, hairy texture. Mallotus ponapensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various local wildlife species.
